column4: Because almost any change to a file will cause its MD5 hash to also change, the MD5 hash is commonly used to verify the integrity of files
you need to burn the iso image (choose burn image
http://www.nullriver.com/products/winmd5sum
you need to check the ISO before you burn
compare with the hashes on this page with the version you downloaded: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UbuntuHashes
the hashes have to be identical*
you want to choose write image file to disc
The ISO file is still just the ISO file.  It's not an image file in it's inherent form, is it?
So it is an image file.  K - writing image file to disc, here goes ...
do yo have a dell?
press the blue button at boot- when the post screen comes up (post is the screen before you see the winxp boot splash screen
While either of the following messages is displayed at the lower left area of the screen, press the F12 key to display the boot menu:

At the bottom of the screen it reads "Press f4 to select alterna
